page.title: 04 LUDDINGTON EXPERIMENTAL STA
page.content: THE LUDDINGTON EXPERIMENTAL HORTICULTURAL STATION WAS ESTABLISHED BY THE GOV.IN 1949 AS ONE OF 9 CENTRES FOR EXPERIMENTAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL WORK WITH AIMS TO FACILITATE FINANCIALLY SOUND HORTICULTURAL BUSINESSES HAVING PARTICULAR CONCERN FOR FRUIT AND VEG. CROPS GROWN IN THE W.MIDS. SINCE ITS OPENING CHANGES HAVE TAKEN PLACE IN THE EMPHASIS OF EXERIMENTAL WORK;IN THE IMMEDIATE POST W.W.2 YEARS YIELD WAS THE MAIN CONCERN,TODAY IT IS QUALITY IN TERMS OF SIZE,SHAPE,STORAGE, PACKAGING,AND PRESENTATION. CHANGES IN EATING HABITS LARGELY ASSOCIATED WITH IMMIGRANT COMMUNITIES, HOLIDAY TRAVEL,AND OTHER COMMUNICATION FACILITIES HAVE PROMOTED RESEARCH INTO THE PRODUCTION OF FOODSTUFFS NORMALLY INDIGENOUS TO OTHER CONTINENTS.ALSO, THERE IS AN INCREASING CONCERN FOR DEVELOPING TECHNIQUES AND SPECIES TO
